threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, version 1 (ARM), statically linked, with debug_info, not stripped

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This binary is a specialized DDoS botnet agent, likely a variant of the Gafgyt (Bashlite) or Mirai families, targeting ARM-based IoT devices. It demonstrates clear malicious intent through its C2 architecture and extensive attack suite. Key behaviors include daemonizing via fork(), hiding its process name using prctl(), and maintaining a persistent connection to a command-and-control (C2) server. Upon connection, it sends an 'INFECTED' status message and waits for instructions to launch various network floods. The binary contains numerous dedicated flood functions (UDP, TCP with custom flags, HTTP, LDAP, NTP, SNMP, and specialized floods named OVH, ZAP, NUKE, and PAKI). It also includes functionality to tamper with the system watchdog (/dev/watchdog) to prevent reboots, and logic for raw packet crafting and IP spoofing.
